Uses of Class
org.kawanfw.file.api.client.RemoteFile

  • Packages that use RemoteFile 
    Package Description
    org.kawanfw.file.api.client
    Provides classes and interfaces for transferring files between a Client and a Server, accessing remote files and directories or to call remote Java methods through an HTTP session.

    • Uses of RemoteFile in org.kawanfw.file.api.client

      Methods in org.kawanfw.file.api.client that return RemoteFile 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RemoteFile RemoteFile.getAbsoluteFile()
      Returns the absolute form of this abstract pathname.
      RemoteFile RemoteFile.getCanonicalFile()
      Returns the canonical form of this abstract pathname.
      RemoteFile RemoteFile.getParentFile()
      Returns the abstract pathname of this abstract pathname's parent, or null if this pathname does not name a parent directory.
      RemoteFile[] RemoteFile.listFiles()
      Returns an array of abstract pathnames denoting the files in the directory denoted by this abstract pathname.
      RemoteFile[] RemoteFile.listFiles(FileFilter filter)
      Returns an array of abstract pathnames denoting the files and directories in the directory denoted by this abstract pathname that satisfy the specified filter.
      RemoteFile[] RemoteFile.listFiles(FilenameFilter filter)
      Returns an array of abstract pathnames denoting the files and directories in the directory denoted by this abstract pathname that satisfy the specified filter.
      Methods in org.kawanfw.file.api.client with parameters of type RemoteFile 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int RemoteFile.compareTo(RemoteFile pathname)
      Compares two abstract pathnames lexicographically.
      boolean RemoteFile.renameTo(RemoteFile dest)
      Renames the file denoted by this abstract pathname.
      Constructors in org.kawanfw.file.api.client with parameters of type RemoteFile 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteInputStream(RemoteFile remoteFile)
      Creates a RemoteInputStream by opening a connection to an actual remote file, the file named by the RemoteFile object file in the remote file system.
      RemoteOutputStream(RemoteFile remoteFile, long length)
      Creates an output stream to write to the remote file represented by the specified RemoteFile object.
